intro: Ardisia tawaensis, commonly known as the Tawake tawa, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to New Zealand and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and small, urn-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forests and shrublands. Its fruit is a dark red berry that contains several seeds. Ardisia tawaensis plays an important role in the ecological systems of its native habitat.
